body: This is a resubmission of #264 to clean up the commits.

[Reef-pull-request-windows #504](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/504/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request
@markusweimer the changes are correct. It should be ready to push if the build passes
Closing this one. Will use instead #266

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #662](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/662/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
Seems like this fixed the issues. I will merge.
Thanks!
I'll do a pass.

@dkm2110 I did a pass. Many small comments. Generally, it would help to reduce the number of comments to use the IDE to remove all unused imports and to minimize the changes such that pure formatting changes aren't part of the diff.

Or not. This has another checkstyle violation: `src\main\java\org\apache\reef\io\data\output\OutputService.java[0] (javadoc) JavadocPackage: Missing package-info.java file.`

Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #668](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/668/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
Sorry for bothering you @markusweimer. I double checked that there was no checkstyle violation left except HiddenField ([REEF-439](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-439))
The checkstyle issue was introduced after you last edited this pull request. I will merge it now to make sure other checkstyle violations don't creeping up on it :-)

Oh well, now RAT found something. `lang/java/reef-io/src/main/java/org/apache/reef/io/data/output/TaskOutputStreamProvider.java` doesn't have the right license. I feel uncomfortable adding that as part of the merge, so please add it.

And if any committer is available in your time zone, by all means merge this before checkstyle moves ahead again :-)
@bgchun @shravanmn @dkm2110 @beysims  either of you available to review this? I can do style checks and such, but this is too important not to be checked by a person with experience in networking.
I have done to pass to incorporate markus changes.
Oh, I should have double checked that. Now the license header is added. Please merge this.
Thanks, I will merge this.
@markusweimer I can review it early next week.
I will test and merge it.
I'll merge this.
@taegeonum you might want to merge this with current `master` before @bgchun reviews it. We've had quite a few changes since this was posted.
@dkm2110 [REEF-436] is merged. You should be able to make these classes now `internal` without breaking the tests.

changed modifier to internal. please review and merge

On Thu, Jul 2, 2015 at 2:29 PM, Markus Weimer notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @dkm2110 https://github.com/dkm2110 [REEF-436] is merged. You should be
> able to make these classes now internal without breaking the tests.
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/261#issuecomment-118173107
> .
@dafrista Thanks! I will merge this.

@shravanmn Can you take a look? If you cannot, I will take a look and merge this. 

@jsjason Can you address merge conflicts? Let's review this request in time.
@taegeonum Any changes we need to consider before I review this request?
@bgchun No changes. Please review this request. Thanks!

@taegeonum I made a pass. There is no test that uses StreamingCodec. Could you add one?  
After you address my comments, let me know.
@jsjason We haven't heard from @shravanmn yet. Can you address the conflicts so that I can review your code? Thanks.

[Reef-pull-request-windows #520](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/520/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

@taegeonum The build servers merge current `master` into the code before building. And we recently made rat part of the build. If you merge (or rebase onto) master on your side, you should see the same behavior / error.

@bgchun I will rebase current commits and let you know if all of the comments are addressed.

## 

Byung-Gon Chun

This is a bit strange. I ran all tests and `mvn apache-rat:check` after deleting my .m2 folder, but no errors occur for me, both on Mac and Ubuntu. The error message that the build server generates:

```
...
[INFO] Exclude: Org.Apache.REEF.Common/Avro/*
[INFO] Exclude: Org.Apache.REEF.Tests/ConfigFiles/evaluator.conf
[INFO] Exclude: Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests/evaluator.conf
[INFO] Exclude: Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests/simpleConstructorJavaProto.bin
[INFO] 838 resources included (use -debug for more details)
[INFO] Rat check: Summary of files. Unapproved: 2 unknown: 2 generated: 0 approved: 833 licence.
...
```

appears as 

```
...
[INFO] Exclude: Org.Apache.REEF.Common/Avro/*
[INFO] Exclude: Org.Apache.REEF.Tests/ConfigFiles/evaluator.conf
[INFO] Exclude: Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests/evaluator.conf
[INFO] Exclude: Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests/simpleConstructorJavaProto.bin
[INFO] 15 resources included (use -debug for more details)
Warning:  org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser: Property 'http://www.oracle.com/xml/jaxp/properties/entityExpansionLimit' is not recognized.
Compiler warnings:
  WARNING:  'org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl: Property 'http://javax.xml.XMLConstants/property/accessExternalDTD' is not recognized.'
Warning:  org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser: Feature 'http://javax.xml.XMLConstants/feature/secure-processing' is not recognized.
Warning:  org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser: Property 'http://javax.xml.XMLConstants/property/accessExternalDTD' is not recognized.
Warning:  org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser: Property 'http://www.oracle.com/xml/jaxp/properties/entityExpansionLimit' is not recognized.
[INFO] Rat check: Summary of files. Unapproved: 0 unknown: 0 generated: 0 approved: 15 licence.
```

to me. It seems that the build server is recognizing something that my local machine isn't.

@bgchun I will refactor `GroupComm` to use current `NetworkSeriveClient` and deprecate old `NetworkService` in 0.12, after this pull request is merged. We can remove the old `NetworkService` in 0.13. 

I've addressed all of your comments. Please take a look. Thanks!
